original: Hall, Axel Rudolf, arkitekt, Göteborg, f. 4/8/04 i Glimåkra, Krist. 1., av skogs för v. Axel H. o. Hildur Lundberg. G. 33 m. Ruth Johansson. Barn: Ulla f. 34, Birgitta 39. — Slöjdfören. ■sk. i Gbg 21, tekn. sk. i Sthlm 22-23. Uppr. resor t. Danm., Norge, Tyskl., Belg., Holl., Österr. o. Ital. 33-39. Anst. h. arkit. Björner Hedlund 25-27, Sten Branzell 27, Harald Olsson 28, Karl M. Bengtsson 29, K. S. Hansson 30 samt h. byggn:f:an G. Albert Gus-stafsson, sam ti. i Gbg, egen arkit :-verks. 31-40, anst. v. A-B Skånska Cementgj. i Gbg 40-41, egen verks, i Gbg sed. 41. Rev. i gas- o. el:verket i Gbg 38-43>, gode man v. laga skiften sed. 38, länsstyr. omb. v. fastigh :tax. sed. 46, styr :led. i Red. A-B Hallandskust sed. 47. Hobbies: bilkörn. o. träd-g rskötsel.
translated: Hall, Axel Rudolf, architect, Gothenburg, born August 4th, 1904 in Glimåkra, Kristianstad county, son of forest ranger Axel H. and Hildur Lundberg. Married in 1933 to Ruth Johansson, with whom he had two children: Ulla, born in 1934, and Birgitta, born in 1939. Attended Slöjdfören. ■sk. in Gothenburg in 1921 and technical school in Stockholm from 1922 to 1923. Undertook trips to Denmark, Norway, Germany, Belgium, Holland, Austria, and Italy from 1933 to 1939. Employed by architect Björner Hedlund from 1925 to 1927, Sten Branzell in 1927, Harald Olsson in 1928, Karl M. Bengtsson in 1929, K. S. Hansson in 1930, and by building contractor G. Albert Gustafsson, while operating his own architectural practice in Gothenburg from 1931 to 1940. Employed by A-B Skånska Cementgjuteriet in Gothenburg from 1940 to 1941, then operated his own practice in Gothenburg from 1941 onwards. Reviewed the gas and electric power plant in Gothenburg from 1938 to 1943, acted as legal representative for property divisions from 1938, and served as a member of the county tax board from 1946. Served as a board member of Red. A-B Hallandskust from 1947. Hobbies include driving cars and forestry management.

structured.name: Axel Rudolf Hall
structured.description: Axel Rudolf Hall was a Swedish architect born on August 4th, 1904 in Glimåkra, Kristianstad county. He is known for his work in Gothenburg and throughout Sweden, as well as his extensive travels throughout Denmark, Norway, Germany, Belgium, Holland, Austria, and Italy. In addition to his architectural work, Hall contributed to the areas of property divisions, taxation, and forestry management. He passed away in 1975.
